Domain Configuration

Each authentication domain is specified and configured during login. If no authentication domain is specified, the default authentication service configuration is used.

You can create up to eight authentication domains. Each authentication domain is associated with a provider group and realm in Cisco UCS ADA. If no provider group is specified, all servers within the realm are used.

Configure an authentication provider for each domain. Depending on the domain, configure a provider for your domain authentication. You can add authentication provider(s) depending on the number of domains in the environment.
